statement.tex: \text{If A is a square matrix such that $A^2=A$,}\\ \text{then expand $(I+A)^3-7A$ such that there}\\ \text{only first order terms remaining.}\\ \text{(e.g. A, A+I etc).}

step.reason: \text{Anything multiplied by identity matrix is the}\\ \text{matrix itself }\therefore I^2=I \text{ and } IA=AI=A.

step.context: \text{Given $I^2=I$, $A^2=A$ and $IA=AI=A$,}\\ \text{is this a valid expansion for $(I+A)^3$}
step.tex: \begin{align} (I+A)^3 &= I^3 + 3I^2\cdot A + 3I\cdot A^2 + A^3 \\ &= I + 3IA + 3I\cdot A^2 + A\cdot A^2\\ &= I + 3IA + 3IA + A^2 \\ &= I + 6IA + A \\ &= I + 6A + A = I + 7A \end{align}
